content: beginner would likely struggle with expert knitters will find the pattern interesting as well and it should be a quick and fun knit for them i knit with 5 dpns stitches evenly distributed on 4 needles and then work around with a 5th but i have attempted to generalize my instructions for those who use alternate needle set-ups instructions for the fair isle pattern is charted materials yarn solid color for cuffs heels and toes ca 40 g variegated/multicolor yarn for dividing stripes ca 15 g scraps at least 4 colors totaling ca 60-70 g stitch markers needles us 1 2 25 mm or size needed to obtain the gauge for m us 2 2 75 mm or size needed to obtain the gauge for l tapestry needle gauge for m 40 st = 4 inches in blocked stockinette st over the fair isle pattern using us 1 38 row = 4 inches for l 36 st = 4 inches in blocked stockinette st over the fair isle pattern using us 2 40 row = 4 inches skill level intermediate finished sizes unisex m or l stitches/symbols used k knit p purl k2tog knit 2 together decrease one stitch by knitting 2 together ssk slip slip knit decrease 1 stitch by slipping 2 stitches one by one as if to k = knit-wise from the left needle to the right needle then insert left needle into both stitches and knit the 2 stitches together this produces a decrease that leans in the opposite direction as the k2tog to make this st lay a little flatter and result in a smoother decrease ridge at the gusset and toe decreases knit into the back of this decrease st on the next round sl 1 slip 1 insert right hand needle in to the next stitch as if to purl and just slip it over without working it hold the yarn in front wyif if purling or on the wrong side if on the right or knitting slip with the yarn held in the back wyib p2tog purl 2 together decrease 1 stitch by purling the next 2 stitches together turn stop knitting in the round and start knitting back and forth each time you see this direction flip the work in your hands from right to wrong side or vice versa you will see this in the heel construction k1tbl knit one through back of loop insert tip of right needle into the back of the loop instead of the front knit results in a twisted stitch repeat the instructions within the brackets x times i e 4x = repeat the previous instructions in the bracket four times fair isle pattern instructions cast on 72 stitches and begin working the cuff as k2 p2 for 1 25 inches or desired length i have used the cable co method in the pictured socks as i like the finished edge but you can use whatever stretchy co method you like when cuff is done
